meanings.sent1: After moving to the new city, they settled in a cozy apartment.
meanings.sent2: The family finally settled in the countryside after years of city life.
meanings.sent3: The adventurous cat settled in the attic, claiming it as its new home.
meanings.sent4: The dust settled in the old house, revealing forgotten treasures.
meanings.sent5: The warm fireplace welcomed them as they settled in for the night.

meanings.definition: To resolve or reach a decision
meanings.sent1: After much discussion, they settled on a movie to watch together.
meanings.sent2: The jury settled the case after carefully considering all the evidence.
meanings.sent3: The siblings finally settled their argument over who gets the last cookie.
meanings.sent4: The negotiations settled the dispute between the two companies.
meanings.sent5: The students settled their differences and agreed on a group project topic.

meanings.definition: To sink or come to rest
meanings.sent1: The boat slowly settled into the calm waters of the lake.
meanings.sent2: The dust settled on the shelves after the cleaning was done.
meanings.sent3: The snow settled on the ground, creating a beautiful winter scene.
meanings.sent4: The leaves settled on the ground, signaling the arrival of autumn.
meanings.sent5: The sand settled at the bottom of the hourglass, marking the passage of time.

meanings.sent1: She took a deep breath to settle her nerves before the big presentation.
meanings.sent2: The soothing music helped to settle the baby and lull it to sleep.
meanings.sent3: The teacher's gentle voice helped settle the rowdy classroom.
meanings.sent4: The warm tea helped settle his upset stomach after the long journey.
meanings.sent5: The peaceful garden helped settle her mind after a stressful day.
